Description: Small bowl of Nile silt pottery with some organic tempering, exterior coated with red slip with black top and burnished (worn), interior coated with black slip and loosely burnished; with small flat base, curving sides and simple rim
Curator's comments: Most like Black top red ware B79b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair - incomplete and cracked, part of rim missing, surfaces worn.
